entry.title: Ethereumâ€™s Fiery Path: $6.6 Billion Ether Burned Since the London Hard Fork
entry.summary:
Drawing upon recent data, the Ethereum network has incinerated close to 3.46 million ether, translating to a staggering $6.68 billion in value burned since the London hard forkâ€™s implementation on August 5, 2023. Taking into account the 710-day period that followed, the Ethereum network maintained a relentless burn rate, burning an average of over 146,000 ethereum every month.
Ethereum Has Burned 3.46 Million Ether in 710 Days
Nearly two years â€” precisely 23 months â€” have zipped by since the enforcement of Ethereumâ€™s London hard fork, marking the implementation of Ethereum Improvement Proposal (EIP) 1559. This significant change has led to the continuous burn of the base fee portion of a transaction fee on the Ethereum network, around the clock, each day.

entry.title: Copernicusâ€™ Lost Secret: The Quantity Theory Of Money
entry.summary:
This is an opinion editorial by Bitcoin Graffiti, a software developer and graffiti artist.
Source
"Those things which I am saying now may be obscure, yet they will be made clearer in their proper place."Â â€“Nicolaus Copernicus
In the annals of history, Nicholas Copernicus is celebrated as the groundbreaking astronomer who toppled the geocentric view and unveiled the heliocentric model, placing the sun at the center of our solar system. However, there is a lesser-known facet of Copernicus' genius that remains shrouded in obscurity: his profound contributions to monetary thought. While his astronomical achievements have captivated generations, his insights into the nature of money and its effects on economies have largely been overlooked. As thâ€¦

entry.title: Weekly NFT Sales Fall 4.33%, Bitcoin Burials NFT Fetches $1.68 Million
entry.summary:
In the world of non-fungible tokens (NFTs), the sales figures have undergone a minor setback this past week, dipping 4.33% from the previous week, pulling in a total of $148.55 million. With Ethereum standing as an exception, four of the top five blockchains known for NFT sales have witnessed a week-over-week downturn.
NFT Sales Decline for Second Consecutive Week
The past week recorded $148.55 million in NFT sales, marking a 4.33% drop from the previous week. Ethereum-based NFT sales accounted for $88.54 million of the total, constituting 59.6% of this weekâ€™s overall NFT sales, and reflecting a 1.41% uptick from the week prior. Meanwhile, Bitcoin-based NFTs yielded $25.92 million in sales, roughly 17.44% of the weekâ€™s total, but exhibited a significant 14.37% decrease from the previouâ€¦

entry.title: Rippleâ€™s Victory, A Win For Coinbase, JPMorgan Says
entry.summary:
Ripple, the company behind XRP, prevailed in its legal battle against the United States Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) in the past week, causing the cryptocurrency industry to experience a surge of enthusiasm. The SEC had filed a lawsuit against Ripple, accusing the payments and technology company of selling security-like XRP tokens to investors.
Judge Annalisa Torres ruled in Rippleâ€™s favor, declaring that XRP is not a security when sold to the public. According to JPMorgan analysts, this recent court judgment appears to also be a win for Coinbase in its recent lawsuit by the SEC.Â
JPMorgan Sees Rippleâ€™s Win As Positive, But Coinbase Still Faces Challenges

entry.title: Report Unveils BlockFi CEOâ€™s Negligence: Ignored FTX Warnings, Overrode Risk Team
entry.summary:
BlockFi CEO Zac Prince reportedly ignored the advice provided by its risk management team regarding the lending of assets to Alameda Research. The team had made recommendations to exercise caution in such transactions, but it seems that Prince overlooked their concerns.
On November 10, 2022, BlockFi took the significant step of suspending all withdrawals, attributing the action to the collapse of both FTX and Alameda Research. The company pointed to the lack of clarity surrounding these entities as the reason for its inability to continue regular operations. Sadly, this predicament eventually led BlockFi to file for bankruptcy.

entry.title: Europe Expects Its First Bitcoin ETF This Month, Report
entry.summary:
Europeâ€™s first bitcoin exchange-traded fund (ETF) is set to launch in July after a 12-month delay caused by the crypto winter. The fund has been authorized in Guernsey, a more flexible jurisdiction, which will ostensibly help to avoid some of the regulatory challenges associated with the European Union.
Europe to Have Its First Bitcoin ETF Listed After Year-Long Delay
The first bitcoin exchange-traded fund in Europe is expected to be publicly listed by the end of this month, a full year after its initially planned launch, the Financial Times reported on Thursday. The ETF was first announced by Jacobi Asset Management in July 2022.
The asset manager wanted to list it on the Euronext exchange last year but decided that â€œthe time wasnâ€™t rightâ€ after a string of negative events in the crâ€¦

The BRICS nations comprise Brazil, Russia, India, China, and South Africa.

Coinbase, the biggest cryptocurrency exchange in the United States, has paused staking services for customers in California, New Jersey, South Carolina, and Wisconsin. Staking crypto has become the norm, especially as many blockchains are now relying on the proof-of-stake (PoS) consensus mechanism. The US is home to the biggest crypto stakers in the world, and Coinbase is at the forefront of staking services in the country.

entry.title: Inside Champions Ascension: Like 'For Honor' with NFTs?
entry.summary: Plai Labs Marketing Director Payton Kaleiwahea tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about player response to the combat game Champions Ascension in development, which offers arena combat, raid bosses, AI landscape features, and more.

entry.title: Ex-Activision VP Michael Lee: Gaming Is Crypto's 'Killer App'
entry.summary: Former Activision Vice President Michael Lee is now the SVP of Growth at Matter Labs. At the 3XP gaming conference, Lee sat down with Decrypt's Kate Irwin to discuss crypto gaming and give his predictions for the industry.

entry.title: Behind the Scenes with AMGI Studios and My Pet Hooligan
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin goes to Burbank, California for a behind-the-scenes tour of AMGI Studios, the developers of upcoming game My Pet Hooligan.

entry.title: Why Legend of Arcardia Chose Sui Over EVM Chains
entry.summary: Legend of Arcadia Executive Producer Andy Lee tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about the game and why they switched from EVM to new protocol Sui.

entry.title: Rumble Racing Star Game Preview: Is This Mario Kart With NFTs?
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin shares a first look at Delabs' upcoming lawn mower racing game Rumble Racing Star, which offers a large cast of quirky characters pulled from the worlds of Bored Ape Yacht Club, Pudgy Penguins, and more.

entry.title: Why Laguna Games Turned Down 'Game of Thrones' for Crypto Unicorns
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin chats with Laguna Games about why the team chose to move away from an offer with WB Games to develop a Game of Thrones licensed titleâ€”and made Crypto Unicorns instead.

entry.title: Mythical Games CEO John Linden on NFL Rivals Topping 1M Downloads
entry.summary: Mythical Games just raised a $37 million Series C1 round on the back of the early success of NFL Rivals, which has already topped a million downloads in two months. Mythical CEO John Linden joins Decrypt's Andrew Hayward to discuss the launch and impact of NFL Rivals.

entry.title: How Ava Labs Is Approaching Gaming on Avalanche
entry.summary: At 3XP, Ava Labs Head of Gaming Ed Chang sat down with Decrypt's Kate Irwin to discuss some of the biggest Avalanche-based games on the horizon and how the company is approaching and thinking about Web3 gaming.

entry.title: Ogimi Founder David Gull on Why AI Should Be Your Meditation Coach
entry.summary: Ogimi founder David Gull speaks with Decrypt's Jason Nelson about its AI-driven meditation guides and how the technology can enable a more unique, custom-tailored meditation experience for users.

entry.title: VaynerSports Gaming VP Discusses Web3 Content Creators, Decentralized Streaming
entry.summary: Darren Glover, VP of Gaming at talent management agency VaynerSports, sat down with Decrypt's Kate Irwin at the 3XP expo to discuss the challenges faced by Web3-centric content creators, the current state of the esports market, and how decentralized streaming platforms can challenge centralized leaders like Twitch.

entry.title: NYXL Co-Founder on the State of Esports and Crypto Gaming
entry.summary: Rohit Gupta, co-founder of esports team NYXL, chats with Decrypt's Kate Irwin at the 3XP expo to discuss challenges faced by the esports industry and opportunities and experiments in Web3.

entry.title: What Is GameBridge? Inside Shrapnel's Gaming Innovation
entry.summary: Marc Mercuri, Head of Platform for Web3 shooter Shrapnel, speaks with Decrypt's Kate Irwin at the 3XP expo about GameBridge, a feature that simplifies blockchain item composability and interoperability.

entry.title: Gods Unchained Executive Producer Discusses Epic Games Store Move
entry.summary: Daniel Paez, Executive Producer on Immutable X-based card-battler Gods Unchained, discusses the long-running NFT game's launch on the Epic Games Store and the opportunity it provides.

entry.title: 'Play-to-Earn Is Not Dead. It Will Never Die' Says Words with Friends Creator Paul Bettner
entry.summary: Words With Friends and Wildcard Creator Paul Bettner tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about his perspective on Axie Infinity and Web3 games.

entry.title: Cross the Ages Game Review: A Tough But Rewarding Card Battler
entry.summary: Cross the Ages is a digital collectible card game that challenges players to duel online opponentsâ€”and you can even mint your cards as tradable NFTs. It's complex and difficult to grasp at first, but this mobile-first game has some serious strategic upside. GG contributor Ryan Gladwin puts Cross the Ages through its paces.
